website_summaries.verdict: With oversized handles, this tool gives you the leverage you need to slice through medium sized apples.
pros: Has oversized handles for comfort and control
Best with apples under 3.5" in diameter
Dishwasher safe, but consider drying to prevent rust
Grips are angled away from blades to keep your hands safe
cons: Apple slices are often still connected at the bottom when finished

website_summaries.verdict: Easy grip handles on this apple corer slicer make it easier to push down than some models.
pros: Gives you extra leverage to cut your apples
Saves times and makes it easier to eat apples
cons: This model has high sides, making a bit more difficult to fit in the utensil drawer, and sometimes harder to get a straight cut

customer_reviews.title: Works just ok.  Looks and feels like quality but not sharp.
customer_reviews.text: Ergonomic but not very sharp. I find I need to use quite a bit of force if the apple is a large one. Works ok on small apples but still doesn't cut easily. Maybe I had too high an expectation due to the brand. I have 2 young kids and find that I'm always cutting apples for them and I thought this would make my life easier but it's just an ok, marginally better solution. I would love to find a sharper one if one exists. Maybe my sharp Zwilling knife is the best way to cut an apple.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Cheap crap
customer_reviews.text: Field scrapped. You can pick up one this cheap at Wal-Mart and it won't work either. The blades are stamped and not remotely sharp.
customer_reviews.author: D. R. leeTop Contributor: Arduino

customer_reviews.title: Great apple corer!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this apple corer and i'm glad I purchased! i was drawn to this corer in particular because it is Calphalon brand, and I am in love with a lot of their other products. This corer is very durable, easy to use, and sharp. It definitely takes out the time it takes for me to slice up an apple with just a knife, which is why I bought it in the first place. 100% recommend!
customer_reviews.author: JordanLeigh

customer_reviews.title: useless
customer_reviews.text: It is so dull that it would not cut through an apple. I had to force it down and the juice just splashed everywhere. The $3 one from Walmart is sharper than it. Would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Hope

customer_reviews.title: Requires a lot of strength and leverage to work
customer_reviews.text: It’s not very useful to me, to be honest. I’m 4’11” which means I’m not very strong and I don’t have much leverage, and I can rarely get this to cut an apple, it’s WAY too hard. A paring knife is much easier. It’s also useless on honeycrisp apples - doesn’t work on big apples. I was going to donate it but my boyfriend says he likes it (he’s strong and 6’1”) so we kept it. Useless to me, though. Would be useless for kids or elderly probably too. Oh well! I’ve used other cutters before and it’s always a challenge at my size but never THIS hard.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Not as strong as needed
customer_reviews.text: I'll be honest, I'm not that good at cutting up apples with a knife so I much prefer apple slicers. This one is fairly sharp but it bent during use so that I get one huge slice while the others vary and it keeps bending further. I'm still searching for the best corer.
customer_reviews.author: TerryD

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This cutter makes nice, clean apple wedges. I wish: (1) it cut all the way through (it stops just shy of cutting all the way through so the wedges are still barely connected together, and (2) it was easier to clean. But, overall, it does a nice job and it feels sturdy in the hand.
customer_reviews.author: Agnes Gardiner

customer_reviews.title: Quality slicer, just as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I create dessert art & my latest creation is caramel cheesecake candied apple slices, so I have to slice about 10 apples/day. This slicer DEFINITELY does its job. I never put it in the dishwasher & I immediately hand dry it after washing. It hasn’t given me any problems. The one very slight irritation that I’ve experienced is the apple core sometimes getting stuck once the apple is cut, but I’m using YUGE mutant apples, so that could have something to do with it. I love this product. So convenient.
customer_reviews.author: DaShawndra Beaugé

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for apples that perfectly symetrical
customer_reviews.text: I can only use this device if the apples are perfectly round otherwise the segments contain bits of core and pips. Hardly ever use it anymore and prefer to use a decent knife to cut up apples instead.
customer_reviews.author: troobrit

customer_reviews.title: great grip
customer_reviews.text: I've owned and used three apple corers/slicers. Of the three, this is the easiest to grip and apply firm pressure on the offending apple. The materials are of high quality. Mine is a handsome black and gray, although I imagine the manufacturer may vary the color over time. A strong value in a designated AMAZON'S CHOICE kitchen product.
customer_reviews.author: David A. BaerTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Toss out that old, dull slicer and buy this one. So much easier to use, sharp edges. Easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: Got tired of our older apple corer/slicer, just too dull. I love the handles on this model, more leverage, easier to slice the apple. Core comes out easily. Helpful hint: wash this slicer off immediately after use, otherwise the bits of apple skin/meal are very hard to clean when they have dried on the slicer!
customer_reviews.author: NPR MANTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: I was skeptical with it being plastic
customer_reviews.text: ...in places because I've had others break on me in the past but this is extremely durable. If on the fence, you have to try it to believe it. Really like how it gets all the core out. Best for reg -Lg apples vs little ones so you eat more of the apple.
customer_reviews.author: Minkypoo

customer_reviews.title: strong enough to cut through the most defiant apple!
customer_reviews.text: Who would have thunk that an apple could be so firm that it would bend a mere metal apple cutter - well we have found them! So glad to have the Calphalon Easy Grip Apple Corer Slicer to cut through the densest apple around. The ergonomic handles are much easier on your hands than the regular old metal handles on an ordinary apple cutter. This devices feels very sturdy and should serve us well for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie B

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: This product does exactly what it's suppose to. The only thing I notice about it which is not that big of a deal. When you slice through apples the pieces don't come all the way out so you need to push them out yourself. Other than that, I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product!
customer_reviews.text: This is really a great tool. Our other one was a gift then broke. Got spoiled using an apple corer and decided to see if I could find a good one. This is so superior to the one we had. And so worth getting. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: K S

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use
customer_reviews.text: And it works perfectly! One thing I noticed is that it cores larger apples better than smaller apples. I'm so surprised I didn't get this kitchen device sooner, like 25 years sooner~
customer_reviews.author: Rita

customer_reviews.title: I wish it was sharp
customer_reviews.text: I have to use more force to slice an apple with this one than the one it replaced. My old one broke and I didn't look to see what brand it was before I threw it out. This one seems sturdy. I wish I was sharp. I might go back to using a knife.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy C

customer_reviews.title: Looks Good, Works Great and Fits the Bill for Me. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.text: I love homemade chunky applesauce; however, I really don't enjoy cutting and coring 7 or 8 apples at a time by hand. Problem solved! The Calphalon, easy-grip apple divider is an inexpensive, dishwasher safe, man-sized tool, with comfortable easy to control handles and is sharp enough to core and easily slice a medium sized apple into 8 perfectly shaped sections with one easy plunge. Care is necessary with any sharp tool and this one should be stored in a user friendly place. This product looks and feels durable; however, time will tell. I will give you an update after extended use. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Tom McGee

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job and cleans up easily
customer_reviews.text: This easy to clean tool makes it so simple to slice an apple and one quick move. I’m thrilled with this, and it is quite easy to rinse clean. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Dave FSU Fan

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: My old apple slicer broke in half. I found this one on amazon and was drawn to it by the maker. It is very sturdy and easy to use and easy to clean. Highly recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Product works pretty well for its' purpose. Requires a lot of force though and sometimes cuts lop-sided. Not perfect, but pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Crank2Lover

customer_reviews.title: solid design
customer_reviews.text: corer removes smaller diameter. have to remove a small of amount of core and seeds from some slices. design has to balance amount removed with leaving behind the most apple body/slice to eat. body seams solid.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this slicer as a replacement for another name slicer. The slicer is well made and very sharp. What makes this slicer stand out is that the circular corer extends slightly from the bottom that provides a complete cut of the slices from the core. Also like the height of the handles that provide more than adequate clearance from the cutting surface for finger protection.
customer_reviews.author: RonT

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third slicer. The other two were Oxo. This one has higher handles, which is a good thing, but not huge for me. I never knew what happened to the other two. I just found out. I cored a couple of apples to make juice and reflexively threw into the trash the slicer instead of the core. Then I saw the core and was mildly surprised, so I threw out the core. Then EUREKA! I looked in the trash and retrieved the new slicer and realized what happened to the other two! Shakespeare wrote something that would fit well here. About being your own worst enemy. (Please comment if you recall it.) But anyway, watch yourself!
customer_reviews.author: Bill Staley

customer_reviews.title: So awesome, I love it!
customer_reviews.text: We have a 2 year old that eats apples like they are going extinct. I ordered this and my wife openly mocked me: "We don't need that, I can cut an apple!". A week after I got it I caught her using it. It wasn't easy for her, but she did spend a few minutes telling me how awesome it was, and THAT I WAS RIGHT! (my wife saying I was right was worth the purchase price alone!!! lol It cuts CRAZY fast and halves the time to cut up an apple at least. AWESOME!
customer_reviews.author: 44 Year Old Male

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Idea!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know who you are, or what possessed you to create this thing, but you are a genius and I could kiss you! The picture doesn't do this item justice, it's much bigger upon arrival than it looks and would fit just about any size of apple, (unless you're growing mutant apples, which in any case, that just can't be healthy!) This is one of those products I was skeptical to purchase, but I'm so happy I committed to making the buy! It's so simply elegant when in use and my weekly intake of apples has probably increased 10x fold. Love it, easy to use and dishwasher safe too!
customer_reviews.author: E.F.

customer_reviews.title: I found that it took a fair amount of pressure ...
customer_reviews.text: I found that it took a fair amount of pressure to get through the apple and then I had to deal with the fact that the bottom of the apple stayed stuck to the slicer. Since the slicer is quite sharp, it took careful work to remove the slices and core. The slices are quite large (2-3 times the size of those I cut by hand) and the remnant core takes a lot of edible apple with it. It works but having used it twice, I will return to using a knife. It is too much work.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Center core is too small
customer_reviews.text: First use was not encouraging- the blades were not sharp enough to completely slice an apple, and the center section (to remove the core) was way too small. Ended up having to complete the job with a knife (which is why I bought the slicer in the first place). I recommend trying another slicer.
customer_reviews.author: TX1811

customer_reviews.title: Apple cutter
customer_reviews.text: It's big, so it doesn't work well with smaller apples.
customer_reviews.author: jojo35

customer_reviews.title: Apple Corer and Slicer
customer_reviews.text: The Calphalon Easy Grip Apple Corer Slicer is easy to use, clean and is sturdy. It's exactly what I was hoping it would be.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Apple Slicer
customer_reviews.text: What a handy tool to have. We had an abundant crop of apples in our backyard this year. This tool just speeds things up tremendously. Lots of applesauce and sliced apples for the freezer...yum
customer_reviews.author: granny b

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 5 Years
customer_reviews.text: Worked well with all size apples. After 5 years, it is no longer sharp but served me well enough for the price. Replaced it with another model.
customer_reviews.author: Price Above Rubies

customer_reviews.title: Best quality apple slicer!
customer_reviews.text: This is, by far, the best apple slicer available for purchase. I like the grips. They are bigger than average and durable too. I previously owned one made by Kitchenaid. Although I liked it, after using this one I can certainly tell a difference. It cut very easily and with little effort. I feel like it is safer and less apt to slip or lean too far in one direction. It just cuts evenly and cores the apple evenly too. I just through my in the dishwasher. So, cleaning was simple too. I would and have recommended it to friends. I feel like it was priced right and I got my money's worth.
customer_reviews.author: arlaine eaton

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy product that saves lots of time!
customer_reviews.text: This works very well for slicing and coring apples. The grips keep your hands from slipping and allow you to maintain a firm grip on the apple slicer. It's very sturdy and once I started to use it the apple slicer didn't move or slip. I used it to make an apple dessert and I can't even tell you how much time it saved me! Using the apple slicer made the process so much quicker and easier. The apple slicer keeps the apple pieces secure which makes clean up super easy and quick! The apple slicer is very easy to clean and store.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent design--expensive and worth it!
customer_reviews.text: It is the details of design and construction that make the biggest differences in products such as this. This is perfect design--center of cutting knives are convex--cuts completely through the apple, etc. Knife edges are quality and sharp (unlike other, less expensive designs). Handles are elevated enough to save knuckles. Worth the money. There is a saying that comes to mind: "You will remember the quality of a product long after you have forgotten the price"
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, easy to clean, extremely sharp blades. I didn’t have to apply much pressure at all. And the shape allows for room in the drawer without stopping it from closing or catching on things.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Pretty useless
customer_reviews.text: I have to say this is a pretty useless item. The blades are not sharp enough to slice down on the apple (at least not sharp enough for me)..I end up getting a lot of the core itself in the apple slices themselves. I seriously do not think this device saves any time at all. Save your $10 and just slice the apples with a sharp knife.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Rose

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This does a good job coring and slicing SMALL apples, doesn't work so well on large apples
customer_reviews.author: HSV golfer

customer_reviews.title: Does a decent job.
customer_reviews.text: It does a nice job and the large handles are nice, but it may not cut all the way through to the bottom. You have to pull the pieces out. It could be a little sharper too, but then it might be dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly easy to use
customer_reviews.text: So my all metal version was worn out and the center wasn't straight. This was on sale so I picked this over the cheaper designs because it was cheaper. Now that I own it I found it so much easier to use that even if it cost a few bucks more it would be worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Rob S.

customer_reviews.title: Wedgies galore
customer_reviews.text: I've had no problems with this slicer (unlike the one it replaced which broke). On the other hand, the bases of apples can be less than uniform and the core of the slicer doesn't always match the core of the apple. Calphalon, if you're listening, I wish it came with a washable base with a spike to hold the apple.
customer_reviews.author: Dave P

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this slicer after my previous slicer of a different brand broke apart completely mid-slice, nearly taking my fingers off. I was hoping this slicer would feel sturdier and hold up over time, and so far I have not been disappointed. The grip is very comfortable to use and the blades, while very sharp, feel very secure in the slicer. I have used this product on many different types of apples over the past month and it has sliced through each with ease. It also cleans very well in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Farley

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended, takes some pressure, so its best to get leverage standing over the apple.
customer_reviews.author: Kim F

customer_reviews.title: It gets the job done, but is a little ...
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job done, but is a little larger than I expected. The handles are a bit much, so I'm just thinking about storage. Otherwise, it cuts stuff that you want to cut.
customer_reviews.author: The Istari

customer_reviews.title: "Can it core a apple?"
customer_reviews.text: This is a the best ways to core an apple! I use two apples a day in my juicer and although I use the whole apple (core and all) I still find this to be the fastest and most convenient way to cut the apple into small pieces for my juicer. We also use it for making pies and apple snacks to take full advantage of its coring abilities. Very strong and east to use with a nice look.
customer_reviews.author: PRSPlayer

customer_reviews.title: this made my life easy. Its safe
customer_reviews.text: Very lazy apple eater, this made my life easy. Its safe... helps with anger.....and self satisfying. I get so emotionally happy when i have a perfect cut apple. After a hard day at work, cutting apples with this eases my anger. Love this product
customer_reviews.author: Don Pablo

customer_reviews.title: Great Apple Slicer
customer_reviews.text: I needed an apple slicer, nothing super fancy, and this one is perfect. It works really well. The grips are perfect so your hands won't slip. The only (sort of) downside is that it's really sharp... like, really sharp! I know it needs to be to perform well, but since there isn't a cover or anything for it, I can see people slicing their fingers on it pretty easily. Luckily I haven't been a victim yet. :)
customer_reviews.author: Breanne

customer_reviews.title: very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Like all apple slicers, it does require a bit of strength . But the peices are cleanly sliced and the core comes out easily. I wish i had gotten one that was easily adjustable so i could make thinner slices but none of them adjust easily. I love the fact that when ever i want a snack, i can slice them up in a jiffy and i'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: EK

customer_reviews.title: Efficient!
customer_reviews.text: My husband has his choice of 3 apple cutters - this is always his first choice - he has used his old one for three (3) years and this is a new one for him.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Blackwell

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Works great and is super easy to use. I love the angled handles which gives just the right amount of leverage to slice through the fruit. I've successfully used it on Apples and Pears. The only consideration that you might want to make is that it cuts the fruit into 8 pieces, which are actually very large. I would personally prefer 10-12 pieces instead. Just makes for easier eating, especially for the mouths of little kiddos.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Great apple slicer
customer_reviews.text: I’m a huge calphalon fan. I’ve been satisfied with everything I’ve bought from them. This apple slicer is durable, easy to clean and makes apple slicing easy.
customer_reviews.author: Florencia

customer_reviews.title: Get a Good Grip
customer_reviews.text: Cool item, but for big apples you have to put extra push!
customer_reviews.author: love 2 shop

customer_reviews.title: Calphalon is always great
customer_reviews.text: Love this. Cuts my apple quickly and it is very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda in Helena

customer_reviews.title: This little apple slicer is so easy to use and makes your slices so nice and ...
customer_reviews.text: This little apple slicer is so easy to use and makes your slices so nice and uniformly sized. We use this especially when we are fixing a fruit try for something and want it to be a little more fancy or even for a pie when we want all the pieces of apple to look the same and bake the same. We highly recommend this item and most definitely will purchase it again when the need arises.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs B

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love my Easy Grip
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my Easy Grip. It's very sturdy and like the name, it's easy to grip. Someone gave me one prior to this one (A different brand) I fell in love with the concept of it especially having a 4 year old who loves Apple's but it broke on me an nearly cut my hand. So I went on Amazon and chose this one and I love it!!!!! Thanks Amazon and Calphalon❤😍
customer_reviews.author: Glamour

customer_reviews.title: Nifty gizmo
customer_reviews.text: We make loads of apple butter each year, and had always done it with either just a knife or one of those nifty apple corer devices. With this handy dandy apple slicer, we have cut an hour out of the usual hour and a half required to prep the apples. Yes, it does not quite get through the bottom layer of apple skin, but if you pull the core before lifting up the unit, that really doesn't matter. I for one will never make apple butter without it again.
customer_reviews.author: R. W. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste money
customer_reviews.text: I expected so much more based on reviews. This is anything but sharp, does not cut all the way through, and took enormous effort to break the apple skin. One apple (a granny smith) and one of the blades bent. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: N. Messmore

customer_reviews.title: Calphalon Easy Grip Apple Slicer
customer_reviews.text: I'm so in love with my new easy grip apple slicer. I had an old vintage one but it was getting all bent out of shape after all these years of use. But while shopping on Amazon.com and when I saw this one I bought it but didn't think anything of it, but boy was I wrong. I've been using it since I bought it and I use it at least twice a day. and it's simply fantastic. It's sturdy and it's easy grip is just great on my hands which are crooked from rheumatism and arthritis. Very easy to hold. You'll love it. Easy to clean also. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Nathalie Brault

customer_reviews.title: Perfect slices
customer_reviews.text: this thing makes perfect apple slices and very quickly. Cleaning takes seconds and its back in the drawer. Works just as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: gustave N

customer_reviews.title: I had a difficult time making nice apple slices and have still had to cut the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this a few times but it did not make slicing apples any easier for me. It seems that if the apple is not perfectly symmetrical this will just make a mess of it. I had a difficult time making nice apple slices and have still had to cut the core out of the slices by hand. I don't feel like this is worth having in my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: dannar00

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I've never owned one of these before, I wish I had! Easy to cut many apples without any danger like using a knife. Also you can quickly dice them up after the initial cut. Just make sure to remove the apple core as the seeds are unhealthy to eat.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Decent slicer
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Four stars only because the size allows for only medium to medium large apples with fairly narrow cores. Before you go out to get apples to slice with this thing, wait for the item to arrive and see how wide it is. I like how the blades are not sharpened so it is reasonably safe to keep out.
customer_reviews.author: Kim G.

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. Would recommend for lazy people. Very sharp so be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Was exactly what i wanted! Strong platic where you don't have to be shy on really putting your weight on it to go through those pesky apples. I'd say any down fall of this product is there's no really good way to take the slices of the product or take the core out.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Lloyd Horn

customer_reviews.title: Makes my life easier
customer_reviews.text: I love apples, I hate slicing them. I love that all I have to do is set an apple down, position this correctly and press down and that is it. If you align this correctly it will not leave any of the core on the apples. Glad I got this.
customer_reviews.author: vc

customer_reviews.title: Hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: This does the job of cutting apples and pears and the like, but the only issue, and it's a big one for me, is that you can't get the little chunks of food out of the bottom where the outer blades attach to the corer when you are trying to clean it. I'll be looking for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Lee

customer_reviews.title: Very good value
customer_reviews.text: We have used it in 25+ apples and it doesn't seem to be losing its edge. Best one we've ever purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan K

customer_reviews.title: calphalin apple slicer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this apple slicer in particular since it had the rubber easy grip handles. I've used another Apple slicer previously without the rubber grips. Pend a few dollars extra for the rubber grip feature.bits worth the extra few dollars. The cutting blades are sharp, but not sharp enough to cut your skin. Kid Nd adult friendly. I highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Works really well
customer_reviews.text: Sharp, slices and cores apples and pears really well and easy to clean. I like that the handles are set higher up than most other slicers ans have a soft grip. Overall another handy kitchen gadget that makes life a little easier.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S.Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: It cuts my pears and apples pretty well. It stops a little short at the bottom so you have to use your hands to push it the rest of the way so you have to be careful not to cut yourself. Also not all pears and apples have cores exactly in the middle so you may have a little of the seed case on the part you want to eat. Still it takes a lot of the work out of cutting it up for my toddler so I am pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Billie Belshan

customer_reviews.title: Solid and works.
customer_reviews.text: It works pretty well on the apples I tried. But it also works surprisingly well on pears. Since I am not the tallest person, I found I have more leverage when I don't put it on my block cutting board, but on a little lower table. Then I can push down easier in one quick movement. It won't work well when one tries to go slow. I found that out quick. Just a quick straight down hard fast push. Seems really well made.
customer_reviews.author: Atunah

customer_reviews.title: Clearly the right purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I love eating apples (and really any other fruit) yet hate eating them off the core while at work for fear of getting the fruity flesh stuck in my teeth. Enter this product. WHAM! Problem solved. Nothing more need be said. Buy it if you are in the market for a thingy that cuts other things into slices. DUH.
customer_reviews.author: David Lyle III

customer_reviews.title: The slicer does not cut the apple slices completely apart ...
customer_reviews.text: The slicer does not cut the apple slices completely apart. To me, that's the whole point. The very bottom of the apple is still intact, so all of the slices are attached by the peeling.
customer_reviews.author: Myra

customer_reviews.title: Very nice Apple Slicer
customer_reviews.text: Am unable to review as this was a gift. I just know the party like it, especially for pre-teen and teen kids.
customer_reviews.author: Janet L McDuff

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use....
customer_reviews.text: Makes slicing apples as simple as 1-2-3. If you like your apples without the peel then you need to peel it first... then place the apple on a cutting board... line up the stem in the coring hole and push... smallish apples are now ready to eat .... most apples however leave a little of the seed pod that is quickly and easily removed with a pairing knife.
customer_reviews.author: NY Rebel

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Works well with all but the largest apples.. I got some 15 oz cosmic crisp apples that didn't fit, but I love how well it works on normal size apples
customer_reviews.author: Robert neal

customer_reviews.title: Not sharp or large enough
customer_reviews.text: Not very sharp and not very large. I have to put my whole body weight on it and rock it back and forth to get it to cut through apples (it hasn't dulled either -- this has happened since I received it two months ago). Also, you may not be able to cut large apples. Some of the Honeycrisp apples I buy from Costco are too wide to fit.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: On the fence....
customer_reviews.text: Well made, high quality...but it's just hard to get the apple through it. I am a strong person,but it takes some force to core a standard apple with this.I've used it several times, and will continue to use it...and I think it will last. I'm just not sure it is the easiest one to use out there on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Family

customer_reviews.title: Best yet
customer_reviews.text: My fourth slicer in recent years. First cheap supermarket one did the trick but rusted. Another cheap one failed to slice. Tried the Oxo brand recently and apple bits got stuck in the crevices of the blades. This one however is near perfect and cuts cleanly with good leverage and cleans up fast due to a better design of the blades.
customer_reviews.author: Victor E

customer_reviews.title: Not so convenient
customer_reviews.text: Not so good for me. Wouldnt cut staight through apple as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha M Clark

customer_reviews.title: Perfect apple slicer
customer_reviews.text: Best slicer we've found! Sharp edges make for easy slicing. The extra large handles make it easy to use and even allows my 3 year old to "help." It's been easy to keep clean and hasn't dulled/rusted like some other versions we have tried. Will definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Becky Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: very sturdy, I use this daily and broke my old one, this one is pretty sturdy and will cut a large apple without having to stand on the handles.
customer_reviews.author: Tami :D

customer_reviews.title: It's not the sharpest thing
customer_reviews.text: I'd read people warning about how sharp this is. It seemed sharp at first, but after having done several apples - and it's not like I chop apples every week - it's a lot harder to chop them now. I still find this very useful for chopping, it's way easier than chopping them up yourself, but honestly I'd have preferred something a bit sharper.
customer_reviews.author: HalfGeek

customer_reviews.title: Not sharp
customer_reviews.text: Well it stopped cutting after awhile due to the blades not being sharp enough and since there is no way of sharpening the blades I have to throw it out
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Calphalon Easy Grip Apple Corer Slicer
customer_reviews.text: There's no apple slicer on the market that lasts as long as they claim. But I've gotten good service with the Calphalon so far.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas N. Chambless

customer_reviews.title: This apple cutter works great for me and my family
customer_reviews.text: This apple cutter works great for me and my family. I like that the easy grip handles allows you to apply alot of pressure to make sure you get the perfect slices. it's nice too because it allows you to slice the apple without your hands being covered in juice
customer_reviews.author: Blondie719

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: This was so worth buy especially when you are on the run. Less than 5 sec you are all done and pack it up in a baggie for snack! I’ve been eating a lot more apples!
customer_reviews.author: dania quezada

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, comfortable and solid
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this purchase. Sure, you can go to the local market or box store and buy one for less, but this one is of great quality, feels great with it's grips and the blades are very sharp and of reliable thickness. I've had it for a month and use it daily, but I'm sure I'll have it for many years at this point as it feels like it's not going to break anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: Cheesey Mac Gravy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and effective! It really feels like a quality tool that will last. And it's pretty sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great so far.
customer_reviews.text: A bit harder to push down than I thought it'd be but still pretty great so far.
customer_reviews.author: Kylie C.

customer_reviews.title: Works well, Calphalon quality, what's not to like?
customer_reviews.text: I had gotten a supermarket-brand apple slicer and it was driving me nuts. Cheap quality, lousy blades, just annoying to use. Most of my pots, pans, and bakeware are Calphalon, so I decided to try their apple slicer. It's a nice unit. Very sturdy, blades are sharpened (not cut-your-finger-off-easily so, but, still, have a care with them), handles are wide and rubber-gripped, overall exactly what I wanted. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: C. Kenyon

customer_reviews.title: You have to put a lot of weight down on this device to get it to cut through the Apple.
customer_reviews.text: You have to put a lot of weight down on this device to get it to cut through the Apple.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Happy wife, happy life!
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this. She uses it to cut apples to make chunky home-made applesauce. Loves the grips and feels that the sharpness of the blades are just about perfect. Will be watching how the edge holds up, and how well it cleans up over time.
customer_reviews.author: S. Garsson

customer_reviews.title: Cuts apples into slices in se
customer_reviews.text: The second one I've gotten. This one sliced the apples and skin in a breeze. The other one I have is almost impossible to use.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Best Apple Slicer Ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the fastest way to slice an apple. If the apple is a good shape, it's easy, if it's mishapen, you gotta work with it, but it still works and makes eating apples easy. I dip the slices in peanut butter.
customer_reviews.author: Sephethus

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I liked this so much, I bought a 2nd one for our travel trailer!
customer_reviews.author: Busy RN

customer_reviews.title: Nice wide, soft handles
customer_reviews.text: Nice wide, soft handles, line it up, press down, apple slices. Makes short work of a bag of apples, turn them all into slices, into a Tupperware bowl and into the fridge to have apple slices ready for munching all week long.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: but my family insists on using an apple corer/slicer - and this one is the best we've had yet
customer_reviews.text: Personally, I prefer to cut up apples with a knife, but my family insists on using an apple corer/slicer - and this one is the best we've had yet! It's rust-resistant, dishwasher safe, and easy enough for the kids to use once they get the hang of applying equal pressure to both handles.
customer_reviews.author: Supa D

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: So simple, so great. You'll never core an apple by hand again!
customer_reviews.author: nocooking

customer_reviews.title: Great for a quick snack
customer_reviews.text: I buy more apples now because of the easy cutting and core remover
customer_reviews.author: Betty Montiel

product_meta.title: Calphalon Easy Grip Apple Corer Slicer
product_meta.description: Size:1The Calphalon apple corer and apple slicer divides apples in one quick, comfortable step. Our apple divider features oversized, off-set handles to give you great leverage and control. The stainless steel blades stay sharp over a lifetime of use. It’s also ideal for dividing pears.
feature_bullets: Apple slicer has oversized handles for comfort and control
